title: Current into page magnetic field graph of x-axis

content.question: A long straight wire is located at the origin of an xy-coordinate system and is perpendicular to the xy-plane. The wire has a current that is directed into the page, as shown in the figure above. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnetic field <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mi>B</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> due to the current as a function of the position x along the x-axis? Assume a positive magnetic field to be directed in the +y direction.

choices.label: The graph has two parts. One part is concave down in the third quadrant. It asymptotes with both the negative x axis and the negative y axis. The other part is concave up in the first quadrant. It asymptotes with both the positive x axis and the positive y axis.

The graph has two parts. One part is concave up in the second quadrant. It asymptotes with both the negative x axis and the positive y axis. The other part is concave down in the fourth quadrant. It asymptotes with both the positive x axis and the negative y axis.

he graph has two parts. One part is concave up inthe second quadrant. It asymptotes with both the negative x axis and the positive y axis. The other part is concave up in the first quadrant. It asymptotes with both the positive x axis and the positive y axis.

The graph is symmetric about the vertical axis. It begins on the left as concave up just above the negative x axis, extends toward the positive vertical axis, becomes concave down and reaches a peak at the vertical axis, and then is mirrored above the positive x axis.

The graph is symmetric about the vertical axis. It begins on the left as concave down just below the negative x axis, extends toward the negative vertical axis, becomes concave up and reaches its lowest point at the vertical axis, and then ¡s mirrored below the positive x axis.

content.answer: The graph has two parts. One part is concave up in the second quadrant. It asymptotes with both the negative x axis and the positive y axis. The other part is concave down in the fourth quadrant. It asymptotes with both the positive x axis and the negative y axis.

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
